User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux armv7l; rv:78.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/78.0

Steps to reproduce:

i tried to download Firefox 86 for Raspberry Pi OS (RPi 4B with an ARM CPU) from the official Get Firefox web page.
but there are no binaries available for Raspberry Pi OS (ARM).

i also tried to get Firefox 86 via flatpak and flathub, by following:
https://flatpak.org/setup/Raspberry%20Pi%20OS/
https://flathub.org/apps/details/org.mozilla.firefox

sudo apt install flatpak
sudo flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo
sudo reboot

sudo flatpak install flathub org.mozilla.firefox
    Looking for matches…
    error: Nothing matches org.mozilla.firefox in remote flathub

but it seems there is no firefox...

the Firefox-ESR is available in the repository, but that version is missing many features i am interested in and want to use.


Actual results:

there are no binaries of Firefox 86 available for Raspberry Pi OS (ARM).

also no flatpak
sudo flatpak install flathub org.mozilla.firefox
    Looking for matches…
    error: Nothing matches org.mozilla.firefox in remote flathub



Expected results:

i expect a binary of Firefox 86 (current release) for Raspberry Pi OS (ARM)
or at least a working flatpak with the current release of Firefox.

In this case, it would be up to the distro to build their own version of Firefox.
comments.creator: mozilla@kaply.com
comments.raw_text:
We don't built Linux on ARM and as far as I know have no plans to.

In this case, it would be up to the distro to build their own version of Firefox.

the distro ("Raspberry Pi OS" is a variant of Debian) does only has Firefox-ESR in their repository (Buster and Bullseye).
Debian has a Firefox in their unstable/testing repository (sid), but Raspberry Pi OS don't.

i tried to mix up my existing Raspberry Pi OS (Buster [armhf]) with Debian (Sid [armhf]), but that was a very bad idea.
just after installation Firefox 86 was working unstable and the system did hang badly at the reboot. i guess it is because of many essential libraries were installed from Sid and replaced the older ones, system needed to work.
so i reinstalled my normal Raspberry Pi OS.
